intro: Wollastonia tenuis, commonly known as the slender woollybush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Wollastonia tenuis is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
